N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2302.5 - Advisory council activities

State Regulations
(a) Throughout the second year of title IV of
the Elementary and Secondary Education Act the State advisory council has been
very active in fulfilling its advisory role. The title IV of the Elementary and

Secondary Education Act administrators and evaluators have worked with the
advisory council in supplying necessary information to council members
concerning major policy issues associated with the program. Examples of
advisory activities taken from minutes of council meetings over the past year
include: (1)
review of the part B formula
with subsequent recommendations; (2)
consideration of New York's overall part
C strategy of transferring success; (3)
specific review and recommendations
concerning part C priorities, allocations and project review and approval
criteria; (4)
discussions regarding
the maintenance of effort problem in New York State associated with part
B; (5)
review of title IV of the

Elementary and Secondary Education Act-- Strengthening State and Local

Education Agency programs; (6)
advice on the preparation of the title IV of the Elementary and Secondary

Education Act annual program plan. (b) During fiscal year 1978, the advisory
council plans to continue active consideration of title IV of the Elementary
and Secondary Education Act policy issues. The following planned agendas of
council meetings indicate many of the policy areas which will be addressed in
the 1978 fiscal year. Major issues for part B include consideration of the part
B formula for fiscal year 1978, consideration of the outcomes of part B, review
of the implementation of procedures for project monitoring and evaluation and
review of planning requirements for part B projects in fiscal year 1978. Major
issues for part C include establishing allocations for fiscal year 1978, review
of project validation and monitoring procedures and evaluating the overall
strategy of transferring success under part C. Major issues under strengthening

State and local education agencies include priorities for fiscal year 1978 and
review of projects supported by these funds. Advisory Council Agendas

(c) Evaluation activities. (1)

The New York State Advisory Council for
title IV of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act has accepted full
responsibility for evaluating the overall effectiveness of the title IV of the

Elementary and Secondary Education Act program. Evaluation of the title IV of
the Elementary and Secondary Education Act program has been a topic at every
council meeting held during the past fiscal year. The evaluation plan for each
fiscal year is developed in accord with State advisory council policies and
subjected to their review with revisions being incorporated into the plan based
on their recommendations. Status reports by evaluators concerning
implementation of the evaluation plan have been presented to the advisory
council at each of its meetings. These reports have been helpful in increasing
the council's understanding of the evaluation process. The practice of
utilizing status reports will be continued in fiscal year 1978. (2)

During the coming fiscal year, efforts
will be made to generate special evaluation reports which will be particularly
helpful to advisory council members in fulfilling their advisory role. These
special reports will be timed to coincide with major policy determinations
facing the council. Examples of proposed reports include: report on the status
of the maintenance of effort problem under title IV of the Elementary and

Secondary Education Act--parts B and C; report on the financial impact of the
part B formula on various types of local districts; report on the outcomes of
the monitoring process for part C projects; report on the utility of the part C
strategy of transferring successes. Additional reports will be generated for
selected part C strengthening projects. (d) Reporting activities. During the 1978

Federal fiscal year, the advisory council plans to fulfill its reporting
responsibilities as outlined in section 403(b) of The Elementary and Secondary

Education Act through the publication of an annual report for fiscal year 1977. The report will discuss the council's activities, recommendations as well as
its evaluation procedures and results. The report will be disseminated to local
school districts and interested agencies and organizations throughout the

State. Notes
